relation: configure terminal Example: Router# configure terminal
router ospfv3 [process-id] Example: Router(config)# router ospfv3

address-family ipv6 unicast Example: Example: or Example: address-family ipv4 unicast Example: Router(config-router)# address-family ipv6 unicast Example: Example: or Example: Router(config-router)# address-family ipv4 unicast
event-log [one-shot | pause | size number-of-events] Example: Router(config-router)# event-log
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Enables OSPFv3 router configuration mode for the IPv4 or IPv6 address family.
Enters IPv6 address family configuration mode for OSPFv3. or Enters IPv4 address family configuration mode for OSPFv3.
Enable OSPFv3 event logging in an IPv4 OSPFv3 process.
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {253390=Router(config-if)# ospfv3 encryption ipsec spi 1001 esp null md5 0 27576134094768132473302031209727, 438073=RFC 2401, 323342=Device(config-router)# no compatible rfc1583, 100288=Router(config-router)# auto-cost reference-bandwidth 1000, 438684=RFC 2406, 77126=These rules apply when the same ASBR is reachable through multiple areas, or when trying to decide which of several AS-external-LSAs should be preferred. In the former case the paths all terminate at the same ASBR, and in the latter the paths terminate at separate ASBRs or forwarding addresses. In either case, each path is represented by a separate routing table entry. This feature applies only when RFC 1583 compatibility is set to disabled using the no compatibility rfc1583 command (RFC 5340 provides an update to RFC 1583)., 437789=RFC 1583, 438390=RFC 2402, 109360=Router(config-router)# queue-depth update 1500, 253649=Router(config-if) ipv6 ospf encryption ipsec spi 1001 esp null sha1 123456789A123456789B123456789C123456789D}
textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 5.    event-log [one-shot | pause | size number-of-events] 4.    address-family ipv6 unicast 3.    router ospfv3 [process-id] 2.    configure terminal 1.    enable SUMMARY STEPS This task can be performed in Cisco IOS XE Release 3.4S and later releases. Enabling Event Logging for LSA and SPF Rate Limiting for the IPv6 or IPv4 Address Family Configures LSA flood packet pacing.   Router(config-rtr)# timers pacing flood 30   Example: timers pacing flood milliseconds Step 7 Sets the minimum interval at which the software accepts the same LSA from OSPFv3 neighbors.   Router(config-rtr)# timers lsa arrival 300   Example: timers
textAfterTable: Enabling Event Logging for LSA and SPF Rate Limiting Clearing the Content of an Event Log Enabling Event Logging for LSA and SPF Rate Limiting This task can be performed in releases prior to Cisco IOS XE Release 3.4S. SUMMARY STEPS 1.    enable 2.    configure terminal 3.    ipv6 router ospf process-id 4.    event-log [size [number of events]] [one-shot] [pause] DETAILED STEPS   Command or Action Purpose Step 1 enable Example: Router> enable   Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.   Step 2
